author: zktriumph
content: I would like to add that those of us who are new to the protocol and were bound by our employers/NDAs concerning github contributions which doesn't reflect any activity on our profile, we should follow each other as participants of the cohort-zero.  EthGlobal is hosting a hackathon called Hack Money (https://defi.ethglobal.co/)  this month and some grant/bounty payments required that a participant should have at least 15 followers and we could also contribute to each other's projects,  I am willing to help other participants with their projects so that I can increase my contribution activity.

author: defipunk
content: <@!364458974906548225> what's your take on the cohort-zero repo? I don't want to unnecessarily increase your workload, but if you want, I'll probably continue with pull-requests

author: pipermerriam
content: I'm about to dish out collaboration rights to more people

author: hack3r_0m
content: hi, I missed applying officially via form, as I can see in github repo, it is open for public contributions, so is there any action needed from my side to enter the program?

author: akh4880
content:
hey folks, just wanted to share this super cool resource on Zero-Knowledge Proofs (will add it to the github reading soon) 
https://github.com/matter-labs/awesome-zero-knowledge-proofs

author: pipermerriam
content: Nope, there's no official line between participation and not.  People are getting started with "stage-1" now and I expect most people who participate will be starting within the next 2 weeks.  There will be a public weekly "standup" call happening that will likely start week after next.

author: yanker8220
content: Another good resource for Interactive Proofs / ZK is: http://people.cs.georgetown.edu/jthaler/ProofsArgsAndZK.pdf
